End-of-century changes in the multi-model mean frequency of dry days (<1 mm/day) and days with precipitation in different percentile categories calculated with respect to the historical period are shown in Fig. 2a. Importantly, a projected decrease in the number of winter wet days with precipitation amounts below the 90 th percentile threshold is evident in all regions. In conjunction, the frequency of dry days increases in all MedClim regions. However in CAL, the ensemble-average increase in dry days is projected to be quite small (+2 days/winter) compared to that in the other regions (+8 to 17 days/winter). This small overall change in CAL reflects the balance between projected decreases in the frequency of dry days in the north and increases in the south
